docs.snippet: The insurgent media company has built a devoted following of what it sees as “average” sports fans: unruly, occasionally toxic and aggressively male.

headline.main: Spurned by ESPN, Barstool Sports Is Staying on Offense

docs.snippet: A Houston great-grandmother was put on a rescue boat. That much is known. But how she got off, was rescued a second time and then ended up in the morgue is one of Hurricane Harvey’s mysteries.

headline.print_headline: Twice Saved From Houston Floods but Still, Mysteriously, a Victim
headline.main: Saved From Harvey’s Floodwaters, Twice. So How Did She End Up Dead?

docs.snippet: The Texas city’s response to a powerful storm says much about polarized visions of the country and diverging attitudes toward cities, race, liberty and science.

headline.main: Lessons From Hurricane Harvey: Houston’s Struggle Is America’s Tale

docs.snippet: The Las Vegas gunman was a savvy businessman and an absentee neighbor who lived on his own terms, according to people who knew him.

headline.print_headline: ‘I Wish I Could Tell You He Was a Miserable Bastard’
headline.main: Who Was Stephen Paddock? The Mystery of a Nondescript ‘Numbers Guy’

docs.snippet: Foreign investors are snapping up clubs in Belgium’s second division. The question everyone from Tubize to Leuven is asking is: Why?

headline.print_headline: Belgian Clubs and Foreign Money Become a Modern Soccer Mix
headline.main: Belgian Clubs and Foreign Money: A Modern Soccer Mix

docs.snippet: Videos, police scanner conversations and frantic memories tell the story of Sunday’s massacre in Las Vegas.

headline.main: A Matter of Minutes: Gunfire, Chaos and Death

docs.snippet: For Elon Musk’s company, autonomous driving is just a pit stop on the road to a better planet. Can it survive long enough to get there?

headline.kicker: The Tech & Design Issue: Life After Driving
headline.main: Tesla’s Dangerous Sprint Into the Future

docs.snippet: It has happened yet again: Inevitably, predictably, fatefully, a gunman shot innocent people dead.
He does not look away at his phone, the waitress, his publicists or his steak salad. His expressive brown eyes are always on you. Or in this case, me.

headline.print_headline: Magnetic, With His Eyes on You
headline.main: You Have Idris Elba’s Full Attention

docs.snippet: A visit to the reclusive country reveals the perilous moment we’re in.

headline.main: Inside North Korea, and Feeling the Drums of War
